metadata: (info { (description "Qarqis is a game known from medieval and early modern Ethiopia which seems to refer to an early version of a mancala-style board game.") (rules "Played on holes in a table. Small balls are used as counters.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "1276") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/sow/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Ethiopia, from around 1400 to 1652.") } ) (graphics { (board Style Mancala) }) (recon { (concept "Sow" True) })
